content.title: Pension to Indigent Sportspersons of Odisha
content.department: Department of Sports & Youth Services Department, Government of Odisha
content.details: The Scheme relating to 'Pension to Indigent Sportspersons of Odisha' was launched by the Department of Sports & Youth Services Department, Government of Odisha to provide financial support to sportspersons of yesteryears who are living in indigent conditions.
benefits: The eligible sportsperson will get ₹3,000/- per month as a pension.
Pension in favour of the surviving spouse of a deceased pensioner shall be sanctioned on a priority on receipt of application duly supported by death certificate, legal heir certificate, etc.
The pension will be drawn from the Treasury & credited to the beneficiary's bank account every month through e-Transfer.
eligibility: Applicant should be a permanent resident of the State of Odisha.
Applicant should be at least 50 years of age if a male and at least 40 years of age if a female, with a maximum relaxation of 10 years for incapacitated sportspersons.
Applicant should have represented the State of Odisha in recognized sporting disciplines.
Applicant should not have income exceeding ₹50,000/- per annum.
Applicant should be free from conviction in any criminal offence.

faqs.question: What is the objective of this pension scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to provide financial support to sportspersons of yesteryears who are living in indigent conditions.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Sports & Youth Services Department, Government of Odisha.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for this pension?
faqs.answer: To qualify, individuals must be permanent residents of Odisha, aged at least 50 for males and 40 for females.

faqs.question: Is there an income limit for eligibility?
faqs.answer: Yes, the annual income of the applicant should not exceed ₹50,000/-.

faqs.question: What is the quantum of pension provided under the scheme?
What are the conditions for Cessation of Pension?
faqs.answer: Pension shall cease on the death of the pensioner, or if the pensioner is found to be leading a comfortable life.

faqs.question: Is Surviving Spouse of a Deceased Pensioner eligible for the Pension?
faqs.answer: Yes, the surviving spouse may apply for the pension.

faqs.question: What will be the mode of payment?
faqs.answer: The pension will be credited to the beneficiary's bank account every month through e-Transfer.

faqs.question: How can I apply for the sports pension?
faqs.answer: To apply online, visit the official web portal at https://portal.sportsodisha.gov.in/Citizen/Registration.

faqs.question: What if I fail to submit the Life Certificate by the deadline?
faqs.answer: Failure to submit the Life Certificate will result in the non-renewal of the pension.
